pages.text:
100
 
ISEE
 
Words
 
to
 
Know
 
for
 
Primary
 
Level
 
 
 
 
 
(If
 
possible,
 
please
 
print
 
me
 
double-sided!)
 
 
 
 
 
1

Test
 
Innovators,
 
Inc.
 
 
Copyright
 
©
 
2025
 
     
 
This
 
vocabulary
 
packet
 
is
 
intended
 
to
 
prepare
 
your
 
student
 
for
 
the
 
oﬃcial
 
ISEE.*
 
 
 
This
 
document
 
includes
 
100
 
vocabulary
 
words
 
with
 
deﬁnitions
 
and
 
synonyms.
 
Below
 
each
 
deﬁnition
 
is
 
a
 
line
 
for
 
students
 
to
 
write
 
their
 
own
 
sentence
 
using
 
the
 
vocabulary
 
word.
 
 
 
Students
 
can
 
create
 
a
 
study
 
plan
 
based
 
on
 
the
 
amount
 
of
 
time
 
they
 
have
 
to
 
prepare.
 
For
 
example,
 
with
 
three
 
months
 
before
 
the
 
exam,
 
they
 
might
 
aim
 
to
 
learn
 
about
 
10
 
new
 
words
 
per
 
week.
 
 
The
 
following
 
vocabulary
 
list
 
is
 
based
 
on
 
oﬃcial
 
ISEE
 
practice
 
tests
 
and
 
graded
 
word
 
lists,
 
which
 
categorize
 
words
 
by
 
grade
 
level.
 
However,
 
since
 
the
 
exact
 
words
 
on
 
the
 
test
 
cannot
 
be
 
predicted,
 
students
 
should
 
use
 
this
 
list
 
as
 
a
 
starting
 
point
 
to
 
build
 
their
 
vocabulary
 
rather
 
than
 
a
 
deﬁnitive
 
guide.
 
 
Students
 
can
 
also
 
make
 
ﬂashcards
 
using
 
the
 
words
 
found
 
here,
 
or
 
use
 
the
 
Test
 
Innovators
 
ﬂashcards
 
found
 
on
 
Quizlet: 
https://quizlet.com/testinnovators/folders
.
 
 
This
 
download
 
is
 
not
 
for
 
multiple
 
students’
 
use.
 
Distributing
 
this
 
download
 
or
 
printed
 
versions
 
of
 
this
 
document
 
to
 
people
 
other
 
than
 
the
 
one
 
student
 
for
 
whom
 
it
 
was
 
purchased
 
is
 
prohibited.
 
 
Tutoring
 
companies
 
and
 
schools
 
with
 
interest
 
in
 
securing
 
a
 
license
 
to
 
reuse
 
this
 
document
 
can
 
contact
 
support@testinnovators.com
.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
*The Independen t School Entranc e Examination and ISEE are trademark s owned by Educational Records Bureau. 
2

ISEE
 
Words
 
to

Activities
 
 
for
 
Primary
 
Level
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
16

Activity
 
One:
 
Common
 
Denominator
 
 
 
Directions
:
 
Each
 
set
 
of
 
vocabulary
 
words
 
has
 
a
 
theme
 
or
 
something
 
in
 
common.
 
Write
 
down
 
what
 
you
 
think
 
each
 
group
 
of
 
words
 
has
 
in
 
common
 
on
 
the
 
line
 
below.

Praise

Antonym
 
Clues
 
 
 
Directions:
 
Read
 
each
 
antonym
 
clue
 
(opposite
 
word)
 
and
 
write
 
down
 
the
 
corresponding
 
vocabulary
 
word.
 
 
 
1.

clue:
 
Finding
 
fault
 
with
 
something
 
or
 
not
 
appreciating
 
something;
 
criticizing.

word:
 
____________________________________________________________
 
 
2.

as
 
something
 
extremely
 
tiny
 
in
 
size
 
or
 
amount;
 
small.

____________________________________________________________
 
 
3.

act
 
immediately;
 
decide,
 
act.
 
 
Vocabulary
 
word:
 
____________________________________________________________
 
 
4.

clue:

wrongfully
 
take
 
something
 
without
 
permission;
 
steal.
 
 
Vocabulary
 
word:
 
____________________________________________________________
 
 
5.
 
Antonym
 
clue:
 
A
 
large
 
portion
 
of
 
something;
 
chunk
 
 
Vocabulary
 
word:
 
____________________________________________________________
 
 
6.

in
 
power
 
or
 
eﬀect;

that

not

Activity
 
Three:
 
Fill-in-the-Blank
 
 
Directions:
 
Select
 
the
 
word
 
that
 
best
 
ﬁts
 
the
 
context.
 
 
 
1.
 
As
 
the
 
hair
 
stylist
 
turned
 
her
 
client’s
 
chair
 
around,
 
the
 
client
 
broke
 
out
 
into
 
a
 
huge
 
smile
 
at
 
her
 
new
 
__________.
 
 
 
a.
 
accomplishment
 
b.
 
appearance
 
 
c.
 
labor
 
d.
 
mission
 
 
2.
 
“Please,
 
I
 
need
 
to
 
have
 
the
 
next
 
book
 
in
 
the
 
series
 
right
 
now!”
 
the
 
woman
 
said
 
to
 
the
 
bookstore
 
worker,
 
ignoring
 
the
 
glares
 
from
 
the
 
people
 
she
 
cut
 
in
 
line.
 
The
 
woman
 
didn’t
 
care;
 
she
 
was
 
__________.
 
“I
 
won’t
 
be
 
able
 
to
 
rest
 
until
 
I
 
know
 
what
 
happens
 
next!”
 
 
 
a.
 
crafty
 
b.
 
desperate
 
 
c.
 
humble
 
 
d.
 
uneasy
  
 
 
3.
 
The
 
kid
 
made
 
a
 
face
 
as
 
he
 
tried
 
a
 
lime
 
for
 
the
 
ﬁrst
 
time—he
 
was
 
not
 
expecting
 
the
 
fruit’s
 
_________
 
taste.
 
 
 
a.
 
bitter
 
b.
 
familiar
 
 
c.
 
sorrowful
 
 
d.
 
thrilling
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
20

4.
 
"Don’t
 
miss
 
this
 
__________
 
to
 
join
 
our
 
dynamic
 
team,”
 
a
 
newspaper
 
ad
 
read
 
in
 
a
 
cheerful
 
and
 
alarmingly
 
large
 
font.
 
“Apply
 
today
 
for
 
a
 
rewarding
 
career
 
with
 
great
 
beneﬁts!!"
 
 
a.
 
opportunity
 
b.
 
transformation
  
 
c.
 
triumph
  
 
d.
 
vision
 
 
5.
 
Even
 
though
 
the
 
girl
 
covered
 
her
 
eyes
 
for
 
most
 
of
 
the
 
scary
 
movie,
 
she
 
would
 
sometimes
 
__________
 
through
 
her
 
ﬁngers
 
when
 
the
 
scenes
 
sounded
 
interesting.
 
 
 
a.
 
grumble
 
b.
 
pace
 
c.
 
peek
 
d.
 
vanish
 
 
6.
 
Avery
 
was
 
_______
 
when
 
he
 
apologized
 
to
 
his
 
sister;
 
from
 
that
 
day
 
on,
 
he
 
asked
 
before
 
he
 
borrowed
 
any
 
of
 
her
 
things.
 
 
 
a.
 
beaming
 
b.
 
particular
 
c.
 
puzzling
 
d.
 
sincere
 
 
7.
 
With
 
a
 
ﬂick
 
of
 
his
 
wrist,
 
the
 
magician
 
made
 
the
 
coin
 
_______,
 
leaving
 
the
 
audience
 
gasping
 
in
 
disbelief.
 
 
a.
 
chime
 
b.
 
rage
 
c.
 
snarl
 
d.
 
vanish
 
 
 
 
 
21

8.
 
A
 
skilled
 
detective
 
like
 
Sherlock
 
Holmes
 
is
 
likely
 
to
 
__________
 
the
 
details
 
that
 
others
 
might
 
overlook.
 
 
a.
 
abandon
 
 
b.
 
chant
 
 
c.
 
examine
 
d.
 
neglect
   
 
 
 
9.
 
Although
 
the
 
necklace
 
was
 
her
 
__________
 
treasure,
 
the
 
woman
 
tossed
 
it
 
into
 
the
 
ocean
 
as
 
a
 
powerful
 
symbol
 
of
 
her
 
decision
 
to
 
let
 
go
 
of
 
the
 
past.
 
 
 
a.
 
beloved
 
 
b.
 
ordinary
 
 
c.
 
particular
 
d.
 
thrilling
 
 
 
10.
 
The
 
__________
 
toys
 
were
 
already
 
packaged
 
and
 
ready
 
for
 
shipment
 
to
 
stores
 
across
 
the
 
country.
 
 
 
a.
 
dangling
 
b.
 
familiar
 
c.
 
jolly
 
 
d.
 
manufactured

26

Answer
 
Key
 
 
Activity
 
One
:
 
Common
 
Denominator
 
 
*The
 
following
 
answers
 
for
 
this
 
activity
 
are
 
suggested
 
responses.
 
There
 
can
 
be
 
more
 
than
 
one
 
correct
 
answer.
 
 
1.
 
These
 
words
 
are
 
related
 
to
 
influencing
 
others.
 
Flatter
 
–
 
Giving
 
excessive
 
praise
 
to
 
gain
 
favor.
 
Persuade
 
–
 
Convincing
 
someone
 
to
 
think
 
or
 
act
 
in
 
a
 
certain
 
way.
 
Praise
 
–
 
Expressing
 
approval
 
or
 
admiration
 
to
 
encourage.
 
Redirect
 
–
 
Steering
 
someone’s
 
attention
 
or
 
actions
 
in
 
a
 
different
 
direction.
 
 
2.
 
These
 
words
 
are
 
related
 
to
 
exploration
 
and
 
discovery.
 
 
Adventurous
 
refers
 
to
 
a
 
willingness
 
to
 
take
 
risks
 
and
 
seek
 
new
 
experiences.
 
Curious
 
describes
 
a
 
desire
 
to
 
learn
 
or
 
explore.
 
Voyage
 
is
 
a
 
journey,
 
often
 
long
 
and
 
exploratory.
 
Wander
 
means
 
to
 
move
 
around
 
without
 
a
 
fixed
 
destination,
 
often
 
in
 
search
 
of
 
new
 
sights
 
or
 
experiences.
 
 
3.
 
These
 
words
 
are
 
related
 
to
 
happiness
 
and
 
positive
 
emotions.
 
 
Amused
 
–
 
Feeling
 
entertained
 
or
 
lightly
 
pleased.
 
Chuckle
 
–
 
A
 
soft
 
or
 
quiet
 
laugh,
 
often
 
from
 
amusement.
 
Enthusiastic
 
–
 
Showing
 
excitement
 
and
 
eager
 
interest.
 
Jolly
 
–
 
Cheerful
 
and
 
full
 
of
 
good
 
humor.
 
 
4.
 
These
 
words
 
are
 
related
 
to
 
mental
 
or
 
physical
 
exertion
 
or
 
strain.
 
 
Exhausted
 
–
 
Completely
 
drained
 
of
 
energy,
 
either
 
physically
 
or
 
mentally.
 
Frustrated
 
–
 
Feeling
 
irritated
 
or
 
discouraged
 
due
 
to
 
obstacles
 
or
 
unmet
 
expectations.
 
Overwhelmed
 
–
 
Feeling
 
unable
 
to
 
cope
 
due
 
to
 
stress,
 
tasks,
 
or
 
emotions.
 
Weary
 
–
 
Tired,
 
often
 
from
 
prolonged
 
effort
 
or
 
stress.
 
 
5.
 
These
 
words
 
are
 
related
 
to
 
a
 
state
 
of
 
calm.
 
 
Undisturbed
 
–
 
Not
 
bothered
 
or
 
interrupted;
 
remaining
 
at
 
peace.
 
Carefree
 
–
 
Free
 
from
 
worries
 
or
 
concerns.
 
Patient
 
–
 
Able
 
to
 
remain
 
calm
 
and
 
endure
 
without
 
frustration.
 
Poised
 
–
 
Composed,
 
balanced,
 
and
 
confident
 
under
 
pressure.
